avalancheActivity.comment:
As a consequence of new snow and a moderate to strong wind, wind slabs formed in the last few days in high Alpine regions. These can be released, even by a single winter sport participant and reach medium size.
As a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation moist snow slides and avalanches are possible as the day progresses. Medium-sized and, in isolated cases, large natural avalanches are possible in particular on steep sunny slopes.
Low altitudes: On very steep grassy slopes these can slide on the ground.
Off-piste activities call for experience in the assessment of avalanche danger and careful route selection.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Wind slabs and wet snow represent the main danger. The avalanche danger will increase during the day.

snowpackStructure.comment:
30 to 50 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, fell in the last three days above approximately 2000 m. Outgoing longwave radiation during the night will be quite good over a wide area. The spring-like weather conditions will give rise to increasing settling of the snowpack in particular at low and intermediate altitudes. Above approximately 2000 m there is still a very large amount of snow.
In the last few days numerous small and medium-sized avalanches were reported.

tendency.comment: The weather conditions will give rise to increasing consolidation of the snowpack in particular at low and intermediate altitudes.

avalancheActivity.comment:
The wind slabs of the last few days can still be released above approximately 2500 m. Mostly the avalanches are medium-sized but can be released also by a single winter sport participant.
Gradual increase in danger of wet avalanches as a consequence of warming during the day. Avalanches are possible as the day progresses, but they can be large in isolated cases. In the event of solar radiation this applies in particular on rocky slopes.
Backcountry tours, off-piste skiing and ascents to alpine cabins should be started early and concluded timely.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Early morning: Slab avalanches are possible adjacent to ridgelines. In particular, however, as the day progresses small and medium-sized moist snow slides and avalanches are to be expected.

snowpackStructure.comment:
In some regions 20 to 30 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, has fallen. In particular at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions there is still a very large amount of snow.
The surface of the snowpack will freeze to form a strong crust and will soften during the day. The spring-like weather conditions will give rise to rapid settling of the snowpack in particular at low and intermediate altitudes.

tendency.comment: The weather will be very mild.

avalancheActivity.comment:
The new snow and wind slabs can be released in some cases at intermediate and high altitudes.
In isolated cases the avalanches are medium-sized but can be released also by a single winter sport participant. In the event of solar radiation this applies in particular on very steep slopes.
As a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation moist snow slides and avalanches are possible as the day progresses. Small and medium-sized natural avalanches are possible in particular on rocky sunny slopes.
Backcountry tours, off-piste skiing and ascents to alpine cabins should be started early and concluded timely.
avalancheActivity.highlights: As a consequence of new snow and wind, sometimes avalanche prone wind slabs formed in high Alpine regions. As a consequence of warming during the day and the solar radiation, the likelihood of dry and moist avalanches being released will increase gradually in particular on very steep sunny slopes.

snowpackStructure.comment:
20 to 40 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, fell in the last three days above approximately 2000 m. Outgoing longwave radiation during the night will be quite good over a wide area. The spring-like weather conditions will give rise to increasing settling of the snowpack in particular at low and intermediate altitudes. Above approximately 2000 m there is still a very large amount of snow.
In the last few days numerous small and medium-sized avalanches were observed.

tendency.comment: Slight increase in danger of moist and wet avalanches as a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation.
